marketNews.title: EMAS: Anak Usaha MDKA, IPO dengan Valuasi Rp29-49 T
marketNews.content:
EMAS is a subsidiary of Merdeka Copper Gold (MDKA) and Merdeka Gold Resources (EMAS) planning an IPO offering up to 1.6â€¯billion (10%) new shares at a price range of IDRâ€¯1,800-3,020 per share. This implies target proceeds of roughly IDRâ€¯2.9-4.9â€¯trillion, with a market capitalisation of about IDRâ€¯29-49â€¯trillion.

The proceeds will be used by EMAS for: (1) a capital contribution of IDRâ€¯328.4â€¯billion to PT Pani Bersama Tambang; (2) a loan of IDRâ€¯328.4â€¯billion to PT Puncak Emas Tani Sejahtera; and (3) the remaining amount to repay debt to MDKA.

EMAS, the MDKA subsidiary, plans to develop the Pani gold project in Gorontalo, covering a mining area of 14,670â€¯ha. As of 2024 the Pani project is estimated to contain 292.4â€¯million tonnes of ore with 7â€¯million troy ounces of gold at a grade of 0.75â€¯g/t and reserves of 77.5â€¯million tonnes with 1.9â€¯million troy ounces at 0.78â€¯g/t. The mine life is projected to 2041, with peak gold production in 2033 expected at 500â€¯thousand troy ounces per year.

The company has not yet commenced commercial operations as it is completing a heap-leach processing plant, which is 67â€¯% complete as of 30â€¯Juneâ€¯2025, with mechanical completion projected for Novemberâ€¯2025 and commissioning in Decemberâ€¯2025.

Future processing capacity plans:
1. 2025-2026: heap-leach plant, 7â€¯Mt/yr, gold output 145â€¯kâ€¯oz/yr.
2. 2027-2029: carbon-in-leach (CIL) plant, 7.5â€¯Mt/yr, gold output 355â€¯kâ€¯oz/yr.
3. 2029-2032: upgrade CIL to 12â€¯Mt/yr, gold output 500â€¯kâ€¯oz/yr.
4. Combined heap-leach and CIL capacity of 19â€¯Mt/yr, gold output up to 500â€¯kâ€¯oz/yr by 2033.

Shareholding after the IPO: MDKA 56.5â€¯%, treasury 9â€¯%, public 34.5â€¯% (including 10â€¯% from the new issue, 8.36â€¯% held by Winato Kartono, 5.6â€¯% held by Garibaldi Thohir, and other individual shareholders.

Valuation: post-IPO P/BV is expected at 4-5.3Ã— based on 1Q25 (TTM) financials. A P/E multiple cannot be calculated as the company has posted net losses for three consecutive years.

Financial performance: 2024 revenue US$1.7â€¯million, net loss US$12.7â€¯million. In 1Q25, no revenue and a net loss of US$9.2â€¯million. Up to 1Q25, the only operating segment is mining-service; the mining and processing segment is not yet operating. The lack of 1Q25 revenue is due to the acquisition of PT Puncak Emas Tani Sejahtera, increasing ownership from 48.99â€¯% to 99.99â€¯%, fully eliminating mining-service revenue.

marketNews.title: SSIA projects 2025 profit decline and explores corporate actions
marketNews.content: SSIAâ€™s Vice President of Investor Relations & Corporate Communications Erlin Budiman said the company projects 2025 revenue and net profit to fall about â€“4â€¯% YoY and â€“14â€¯% YoY respectively, below the original targets of +5â€¯% revenue and +20â€¯% profit. The downgrade is based on the backlog of the Sabang Smartpolitan land sales that will only be recognised in early 2026 and a potential occupancy decline in the hospitality segment due to government budget tightening. CEO Johannes Suriadjaja said the company remains committed to a roughly 30â€¯% dividend payout ratio and is adding about 100â€¯ha of landbank by Juneâ€¯2025. He also said SSIA is reviewing corporate-action options and collaboration opportunities to accelerate Subang Smartpolitan development.

marketNews.title: ASII wholesale sales slump 29â€¯% YoY in Augustâ€¯2025
marketNews.content: Gaikindo reported that combined wholesale sales of Toyota and Daihatsu vehicles reached 28,174 units in Augustâ€¯2025 (-29â€¯% YoY, -4â€¯% MoM), bringing the combined 8-month total to 245,781 units (-17â€¯% YoY).

marketNews.title: PSAB denies acquisition rumor, remains open to strategic deals
marketNews.content: J Resources Asia Pacific clarified to the IDX that the circulating rumor that Unitedâ€¯Tractors (UNTR) intends to acquire PSABâ€™s mining assets is unfounded. PSAB stated it remains open to consider strategic transactions that could add value. In a separate information disclosure, UNTR also said it was unaware of the rumor but is seeking new acquisition opportunities. Bloomberg Technoz reported on 4â€¯Septemberâ€¯2025 that UNTR plans to acquire PSABâ€™s mining assets in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: DATA plans ISP acquisition and IDRâ€¯500â€¯bn capex to reach 500â€¯k home-passes
marketNews.content: Remala Abadiâ€™s CEO Abadi Agus Setiono said the company plans to acquire an internet service provider this year to close a home-pass gap. DATA currently has 317,000 home-passes and targets 500,000 by end-2025. The expansion will be funded with up to IDRâ€¯500â€¯billion of capex sourced from internal funds, investors and bank loans. The Djarum group will also purchase additional DATA shares, though details were not disclosed.

marketNews.title: IPCM allocates IDRâ€¯148â€¯bn for two new tugboats and terminal expansion
marketNews.content: IPCMâ€™s Director of Shipping Services Dessy Emastari Prihatiningtyas said the company will allocate IDRâ€¯148â€¯billion through 2026 to add two tugboats, with IDRâ€¯80â€¯billion to be spent this year. CEO Shanti Puruhita said the two vessels are expected to be deployed next year. IPCM is also expanding a new dedicated terminal, especially in eastern Indonesia, and targets a 5â€¯% YoY increase in revenue and net profit in 2025.

marketNews.title: Rupiah slides 1.05â€¯% as BI intervenes after finance-minister change
marketNews.content: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 1.05â€¯% to IDRâ€¯16,475 per US$ on Tuesday (9â€¯Sept) after President Prabowo Subianto replaced Finance Minister Sri Mulyani with Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa. Bank Indonesiaâ€™s Head of Monetary Management and Securities, Erwin Hutapea said the central bank intervened in the foreign-exchange market to keep the rupiah in line with fundamentals.

marketNews.title: Indonesia sovereign-bond auction yields 6.45â€¯% (FR0108) and 5.15â€¯% (SPN12260910)
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Financeâ€™s Directorate General of Debt and Risk held a sovereign-bond auction on Tuesday (9â€¯Sept). Bids totalled IDRâ€¯79.55â€¯trillion; the winning amount was IDRâ€¯24.45â€¯trillion, below the indicative target of IDRâ€¯27â€¯trillion. The FR0108 bond (maturity 15â€¯Aprâ€¯2036) was awarded at a weighted-average yield of 6.45â€¯% for IDRâ€¯3.5â€¯trillion, while the SPN12260910 (maturity 10â€¯Septâ€¯2026) was awarded at 5.15â€¯% yield for IDRâ€¯5.1â€¯trillion.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister pledges sub-3â€¯% GDP deficit and liquidity support
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa said the government will keep the fiscal deficit below 3â€¯% of GDP in line with regulations and will work with Bank Indonesia to ease liquidity and support funding for the economy and government programmes.

marketNews.title: Government to expand stimulus programmes in H2â€¯2025
marketNews.content: Co-ordination Minister Airlangga Hartarto said the government will strengthen economic stimulus in the second half of the year, extending existing programmes such as wage subsidies for workers earning under IDRâ€¯10â€¯million, a labor-intensive public-works scheme, a PPh exemption for certain sectors and housing support. No further details on amounts or timing were given.

marketNews.title: Gold spot price hits all-time high of US$3,659.4
marketNews.content: Spot gold rose 0.48â€¯% to US$3,654 per troy ounce on Tuesday (9â€¯Sept) and briefly hit an intraday all-time high of US$3,659.4, extending a 1.4â€¯% gain from Monday. The rise came as markets priced in a possible Fed rate cut next week. US equity indices also rose, with the Nasdaq posting a new all-time high on Monday.

marketNews.title: AISI reports August 2025 domestic motorcycle sales
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Motor Association (AISI) reported domestic two-wheel sales of 578,041 units in Augustâ€¯2025 (+0.7â€¯% YoY, -1.5â€¯% MoM), bringing the 8-month total to about 4.3â€¯million units (-1.7â€¯% YoY), or 64-67â€¯% of the 2025 target of 6.4-6.7â€¯million units (vs 8M24: 69â€¯% actual).

marketNews.title: Brent crude up 0.4â€¯% to US$66.5/bbl on OPEC+ output increase
marketNews.content: Spot Brent crude rose 0.4â€¯% to US$66.5 per barrel on Tuesday (9â€¯Sept) as OPEC+ production is set to rise by 137â€¯kâ€¯bbl/d in Octoberâ€¯2025, following a decision to increase output after a 550â€¯kâ€¯bbl/d rise in September-August and 411â€¯kâ€¯bbl/d in July-June 2025.

marketNews.title: Freeport pauses Grasberg underground mining after landslide
marketNews.content: Freeport Indonesiaâ€™s VP of Corporate Communications Katri Krisnati said the company will temporarily halt underground mining at the Grasberg mine in Central Papua to safely evacuate seven contractor workers trapped after a landslide on Monday (8â€¯Sept) around 22:00â€¯WIT.

marketNews.title: Rupiah slides 1.05â€¯% after finance-minister change
marketNews.content: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 1.05â€¯% to IDRâ€¯16,475 on Tuesday (9â€¯Sept) after President Prabowo Subianto replaced Finance Minister Sriâ€¯Mulyani with Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa. Bank Indonesia intervened in the foreign-exchange market to keep the rate aligned with fundamentals.

marketNews.title: Other hot topics
marketNews.content: The marketâ€™s â€œhotâ€ list includes: (1) the rupiahâ€™s 1.05â€¯% decline; (2) a sovereign-bond auction that raised IDRâ€¯24.45â€¯trillion; (3) Finance Minister Purbayaâ€™s pledge to keep the fiscal deficit under 3â€¯% of GDP; (4) the governmentâ€™s plan to expand stimulus programmes in H2â€¯2025; (5) spot gold up 0.48â€¯% to US$3,654/oz and an intraday high of US$3,659.4; (6) AISIâ€™s August motor-sales figure of 578,041 units (+0.7â€¯% YoY); (7) Brent crude up 0.4â€¯% to US$66.5/bbl; (8) Freeportâ€™s temporary halt of Grasberg underground mining.
